ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Cantera OS X Troubles with Terminal output (64 vs. 32 bit???)
ygData.msgSnippet: I would recommend you do make clean before make.  I installed cantera on an iMac running Leopard without a problem. Dave

I would recommend you do 'make clean' before 'make.'  I installed  
cantera on an iMac running Leopard without a problem.

Dave


On Dec 14, 2007, at 11:19 AM, Winston Burbank wrote:

> I have yet to get Cantera working on my OS X leopard upgrade (I did  
> upgrade from Tiger, Cantera worked; I upgraded Python, everything  
> broke; and I have since tried reinstalling (without uninstalling)  
> everything several times).  And I have used the % python setup.py  
> build and % sudo python setup.py install scripts with no success.    
> However I do suggest these and any other instructions appear on the  
> "Building Cantera on a Unix, Linux, or Mac OS X Platform" webpage.
>
> Please find below the terminal response from my ./preconfig, make,  
> and make install commands.  I suspect one problem may be that  
> Leopard brags it is entirely 64bit.  I am not sure what settings  
> Matlab has, or other libraries (32bit vs. 64bit).  (I have the  
> Intel Core 2).  I have very little experience in a Unix command  
> line, and I am intimidated to customize the config files.  However  
> if there is any useful info I can send additionally please ask.   
> (the red highlighting was done by me, but I don't really know what
